comments:
When running the test cases for extract method sometimes I get the errors below. The test cases effected by these
	errors vary from test run to test run. Sometimes all tests pass without producing the error. So I suspect that this is
	somehow a multi threading problem. Since we are creating and deleting lots of files, could it be that we try to delete a file
	while the indexer is scanning this file? 


1) test022(org.eclipse.jdt.refactoring.tests.ExtractMethodTests)

NOTES:
EG (5/9/2001 11:16:53 AM)
	I thought that the indexer reads all the files in memory to avoid this problem.
	
PM (5/10/01 12:22:52 AM)
	It does not put JARs in memory (would be too big). Also note that in order to save memory, the indexer will quit copying resources
	to memory. So this might happen everywhere from 0.105 on.
	Ideally we want to run these inside operations, but currently this results in causing core snapshots.

	Our test suites expose the same kind of issues, where you can force the main thread to pause by doing search queries with WaitUntilReadyToSearch
	waiting policy.
	Back to UI.

EG (5/9/2001 8:31:10 PM)
	This has deeper consequences and means a user gets an exception when saving a file
	since the indexer is accessing.
	For testing purposes there should be a way to disable the indexer, for example,
	with a command line argument.
	We can't do anything in JUI against this!
